fields.description:
uAttend - 92329

 

The customer states according the Washington state law, 1 hour of sick time is accrued for every 40 hours worked. When an employee works 84 hours (4 OT hours ) the system only gives her employee 2 hours of sick time instead of 2.XX (not sure what the math equates to) hours of sick time.
fields.summary: Washington customer wishes to have OT calculate towards accrual time

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Images are not working in new blog posts

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In an instance using the new blog posts editor, create a new blog post
# Add an image to it
# Publish the Page

h3. Expected Results
You should see the image.

h3. Actual Results
The image doesn't appear. If you go into Edit mode again, the image is also gone. However, it is still referenced in the Attachments page, Storage Format and Source.
fields.summary: Images are not working in new blog posts

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Contributor's macro results are inconsistent.

Each refresh on the page will generate a different rendering of the macro, changing who were the contributors, how many contributions they've made and when those are made.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Confluence space, add some Contributors macro using some parameters - such as {{@all}} for the *Spaces* field
 # Publish the page
 # Look at the contributor's macros
 # Refresh the page a few times

h3. Results

You'll see that the results change - apparently randomly.
h3. Additional Findings
 * Refreshing the page multiple times will present different results for the Macro.
 * This is the endpoint called when updating the macro:
{code:java}
https://<instanceURL>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/com.atlassian.confluence.contributors/1.0/contributors?mode=list&scope=descendants&limit=5&spaces=<SpaceKey>&showLastTime=true&order=update&contextEntityId=16581596
{code}

 * Calling this endpoint multiple times through curl will also bring different results.
 * Clearing Context Cache and rebuilding the index didn't seem to fix the issue.
fields.summary: Contributors Macro results are inconsistent

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Inline comments Performance in Mozilla Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Mozilla Firefox, go to a Confluence page and add some (20+) inline comments
# Navigate through the comments and/or try to add new ones

h3. Expected Results
You would be able to navigate through them.

h3. Actual Results
The page eventually freezes, displaying a *A web page is slowing down your browser. What would you like to do?* warning message.
 !screenshot-1.png! 

h3. Notes
Adding a lot of inline comments to a Confluence page may cause performance/slowness issues for other browsers as well, but the only one tested that actually crashed was Mozilla Firefox.
fields.summary: Inline Comments Performance in Mozilla Firefox

fields.description:
h5.The issue
Currently, users need to edit space permissions for every space by hand, while it would be very nice to have a feature where administrators could edit those permissions in a single page.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to manage all space's permissions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence Questions Data will not be migrated after Confluence Server to Cloud migration.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce 
 #  Export one Confluence Server space
 # Import the space into Confluence Cloud
 # The import is successfully completed
 # Notice that Confluence Questions will not be visible

h3. Expected Results

 Confluence Questions data should be visible after migration
h3. Actual Results

 Confluence Questions data is not visible
h3. Notes

 
h3. Workaround

 None
fields.summary: Confluence Questions will not be visible after Confluence Server to Cloud migration

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is no longer possible to copy and paste tables in Confluence using the right-click menu or ctrl+C/ctrl+V (cmd+C/cmd+V), only the text is copied and pasted in the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a Confluence page with a table;
 # Enter edit mode and copy the table;
 # Paste the table on the same page or another page.

h3. Expected Results

The table is copied.
h3. Actual Results

Only the table text is copied and pasted in the page.
h3. Browsers

Safari, Chrome, Firefox.
fields.summary: Copy and Paste Tables no longer working on Confluence Pages.

fields.description: HOT: https://ops.internal.atlassian.com/jira/browse/HOT-83571
fields.summary: Error when viewing a page
Users are Unable to Upload Attachments to Confluence Questions Posts

fields.description: When listing the pages using Page Tree Macro, it would be more convenient if the macro displays the labels as well added to the pages listed. Example screenshot attached
fields.summary: Display Labels inside Page tree Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to attach images to a page from Confluence mobile app.

h3. Environment

* Confluence mobile 1.9.2.62
* https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/wiki

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open a page and enter "Edit" mode
# Paste an image to the page
# Confirm if the image was pasted to the page successfully as follows
!upload.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The image should be shown even after publishing the page.

h3. Actual Results

The image was not attached to the page.

h3. Note

In case that you paste an image and type some characters on the page, only the characters was reflected to the page after publishing it.

h3.Workaround

There is no workaround.
There seems to be no option to attach files to a page on Confluence mobile.
When this feature is implemented on Confluence mobile, it would be nice if we could attach multiple files to a page at the same time as we can do it on PC browser.
fields.summary: Unable to attach images to a page from Confluence mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When you import Word document to create multiple pages, it will generate a notification for each page created. Batching of notifications doesn't apply.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Send a single email with all the pages created through Word import.
fields.summary: Single email with all the pages created through Word Import

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new space with choosing "Blank space" # The overview page will load h3. Expected Results Under "Complete these tasks to get started", terms in strong tags are shown in bold and terms in em tags are shown inside quotations h3. Actual Results The tags are exposed. !スクリーンショット 2018-04-19 10.41.06.png|thumbnail! Looking at the storage format, the brackets are loaded as < and > instead of < or >. {code:java}

Complete these tasks to get started

65 incomplete <strong>Edit this home page</strong> - Click <em>Edit</em> in the top right of this screen to customize your Space home page 66 incomplete <strong>Create your first page</strong> - Click the <em>Create</em> button in the header to get started 67 incomplete <strong>Brand your Space</strong> - Click <em>Configure Sidebar</em> in the left panel to update space details and logo 68 incomplete <strong>Set permissions</strong> - Click <em>Space Tools</em> in the left sidebar to update permissions and give others access

 

{code} h3. Workaround Confluence administrator can [fix the default space content page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/customizing-default-space-content-724765519.html].
fields.summary: some html tags are exposed in the overview page for a newly created space

fields.description:
When going to *Settings* > *Manage Add-ons* > *Build a New Add-On*, there are links pointing to the old Connect documentation:

https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/index.html

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Broken link on Build a New Add-on Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Pages with certain macros are not rendering correctly
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * On any Confluence page, add one of the macros below:
 ** Page Tree
 ** Roadmap planner
 * Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The page will load as expected.

h3. Actual Results

The top of the page - with the Author, Last Modified, Edit, Copy, Export buttons - doesn't load. 
An spinner icon is displayed and all the page content is displayed below it.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workarounds

# Manually access the page in edit mode: {{https://<yoursite>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<Space_Key>/pages/edit/<PageID>}}
# Remove any of the macros listed above
# Publish the Page
fields.summary: Pages with certain macros are not rendering correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is not possible to add non-alphanumerical characters to images alt text

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# While editing a Confluence page with an image, click it and select *Properties*
# In the *Alt Text* field, enter any text with non-alphanumerical (!*&%$#) characters
# Click *Save*
# *Publish* the Page
# Click *Edit*
# Go to image, and click *Properties*

h3. Expected Results

The text is still there.

h3. Actual Results

The text disappears.
fields.summary: It is not possible to add non-alphanumerical characters to image's alt text

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Add a Slack channel feed to Confluence (like a Twitter feed, for example).
This could be implemented as a *macro* or as an *add-on*. 

h3. Notes

At this moment, there are add-ons at the [Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?hosting=cloud&product=confluence&query=slack] that send Confluence related notifications to Slack.

The idea would be having the other way around: Slack notifications appearing on Confluence.
fields.summary: Slack channel feed to Confluence

fields.description:
Summary

* The arrows in the page tree are not aligned to the text corresponding to it. Please find the screenshot.
fields.summary: Page tree Icons are not Aligned with the text

fields.description: It would be useful if user is able to pause and play the GIF images from Confluence
fields.summary: Ability to pause and play GIF images

fields.description:
Summary 
 * User is able to view the space when Global Anonymous access is set OFF, but space is given anonymous access. 
 * Please find the screenshots, depicting bug.


Workaround

*  Remove the anonymous access from the space level, then the user will not be able to view the space anymore.
fields.summary: User is able to view space, when anonymous access is Set off Globally, but anonymous access is set at Space Level

fields.description:
The editor keeps loading
labels are broken as the screenshot below
 !スクリーンショット 2018-04-18 14.03.54.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to create/edit page and labels are broken

fields.description: Currently anonymous users are not able to save pages that they have just created. When they click publish they are redirected to login.
fields.summary: Anonymous users are generally unable to save pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Image Properties button isn't displayed for users without Add Comments permissions 

h3. Environment

Confluence-only sites.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# On a Confluence instance, create a Space
# Remove the *Add Comments* permissions from groups/users
# Create a page
# Upload an image to it
# Publish the page
# Click on Edit
# Hover the image

h3. Expected Results

You should see the *Properties* button right next to the *Link* button.

h3. Actual Results

The button doesn't appear.

h3. Workarounds
* Refreshing the page will make the button appear
* Grant *Add Comments* permissions to the users that are facing the issue
fields.summary: Image Properties button isn't displayed for users without Add Comments permissions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attached files do not display if they have an #include in the body

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a text file, with {{#include}} inside it, and save the file with any extension.
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Upload this file to a Confluence page
# Click to preview the file

h3. Expected Results

The file would open and display its contents like any other text file

h3. Actual Results

No preview is shown for this file.

!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

* Click to download the file and view it locally
fields.summary: Attached files do not display if they have an #include in the body

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When trying to export a page with eazyBI graphics to PDF, the eazyBI content won't be displayed in the file created.

h3. Environment 
* Reproducible in
** MacOS - Google Chrome
** MacOS - Firefox
** MacOS - Safari
** Windows 10 - Google Chrome  

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Install *eazyBI* add-on in Jira Software and Confluence Cloud;
# Create an *eazyBI* dashboard in Jira and add the *eazyBI dashboard* macro in a Confluence page; 
# On the Confluence page, click on *... >> Export to PDF*;
# Download the created file.

h3. Expected Results  
* The PDF file created should display all the content of the page;

h3. Actual Results 
* The PDF file created doesn't display the *eazyBI* content.

 !Screen Shot 2018-04-17 at 15.22.16.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2018-04-17 at 15.48.32.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: eazyBI graphics not displayed in the PDF export

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With any macro that has fields to configure, if curly brackets ( \{ } ) are inserted, the macro will display an "Unknown macro" error in edit mode, but will render correctly in view mode.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a macro - let's use the "Info" macro for this example;
 # Click on the macro and hit Edit;
 # In the field (Optional Title in this example) type "Test \{test}" and save the macro.

h3. Expected Results

The macro will be correctly rendered.
h3. Actual Results

The macro is rendered with an "Unknown macro" error on edit mode, as shown below:
|!unknown_macro.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Notes

The macro will be correctly rendered on view mode.
h3. Workaround

No known workaround besides removing the brackets.
fields.summary: Unknown macro error shown if the macro has curly brackets (braces) in a field

fields.description: Confluence users accessing pages that allow anonymous access are redirected to Atlassian Account login screen after a few seconds which makes public pages not accessible.
fields.summary: Anonymous access is unavailable for public pages in Confluence
Variable assignment bug in python hides valuable docker logging when build fails.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users without Create Space permissions and/or without access to other spaces still see a *Create Space* button in Recently Worked On

h3. Description

By default a recently created user will see a *Create Page* button while navigating to *Your Work* > *Recently Worked On*, if he/she has access to any of the spaces within the instance.
If he/she doesn't, a *Create Space* button would show up. However, this button is also showing up for users +without+ *Create Space* permissions. 

+Note: The space isn't created. Instead, a blank pop-up appears as if it was loading, but it never completes.+

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# As a user without *Create Space* permissions, go to *Your Work* > *Recently Worked On*

h3. Expected Results

You shouldn't have an option to create a space.

h3. Actual Results

A *Create Space* button is displayed. If you click on it, a pop-up appears, but nothing happens.

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This may occur with users that do not have explicit Application Access - such as Unlicensed Users from Jira Service Desk Knowledge Base.
fields.summary: Users without Create Space permissions and/or without access to other spaces still see a Create Space button in Recently Worked On

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When navigating on the page tree of a instance, clicking on nested pages, the site quickly becomes unresponsive and error message appear.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud app
* Android and iPhone.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a page on Confluence and put it on Edit mode.
* Add an image. 
* Double click/right click the image > Link > add the anchor link (on my example, #anchortest) > Save. 
* Add some text to the page below the image with link.
* Add the Anchor macro by typing {anchor} or by clicking the + icon > Other macros > Anchor > on Anchor name, type anchortest > Insert. 
* Publish the page. 
* Open the page on the Confluence Cloud app.
* Click on the anchor image link.


h3. Expected Results
* Anchor image link jumps to the anchor. 


h3. Actual Results
* You go to where the Anchor macro is, but then you are redirected to the image file.


h3. Workaround
* None yet.
fields.summary: Anchor macro: image anchor link not working on Confluence app

fields.description:
Summary
When trying to export a Confluence page in another language (say russian) to PDF, ihttps://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-59512#t will not show the text in Cyrillic.

Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page full of Cyrillic 
# Publish it and export to PDF on the page
# Download it and view it from PDF viewer
# Noticed that Cyrillic is not showing the PDF file
# Export the whole space rather than page
# The text in Cyrillic is not showing also.


Expected Results
Cyrillic show be able to displayed in the page.

Actual Results
Text with Cyrillic is not showing in the page


Workaround
The only workaround would be to use the Print button for example in Chrome and save the page as PDF.
fields.summary: Export to PDF in Cyrillic characters are not visible

fields.description:
We are using the copy page hierarchy (https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-pagehierarchy-copy-post) REST resource

However the resource does not give us as much control over how the copying is done as we need

We would want to disable sending notifications to users that are mentioned in the copied pages

- at the moment any user that is mentioned on any of the pages that are copied will get an e-mail that they were mentioned by the add-on user
- in our use case this is not relevant, and potentially a big annoyance to the user
- we would need a way to suppress the notifications when using copy page hierarchy
fields.summary: No way to disable sending notifications on copy page hierarchy

fields.description:
We are using the copy page hierarchy (https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-pagehierarchy-copy-post) REST resource

However the resource does not give us as much control over how the copying is done as we need

We would want to copy only certain content properties:

- at the moment you can specify a boolean to specify if content properties should be copied or not
- what we would really need is to be able to specify a list of keys of content properties to copy
- ideally there would be both blacklist and whitelist option to copy only the content properties with keys in the whitelist, or to copy all the other content properties than the blacklisted ones
fields.summary: More control over copying content properties with copy page hierarchy REST resource

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Files uploaded through the Choose File button on the attachments page lose their extension

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# On a Confluence page, go to *...* > *Attachments*
# Then, click the *Choose File* button to pick a file on your computer - _e.g.:_ {{spreadsheet.xlsx}}
# Upload the file
# Refresh the page
# Download the file 

h3. Expected Results

The file would download normally like {{spreadsheet.xlsx}}

h3. Actual Results

The file downloads and it's name is replaced by an ID, with no extension. _e.g.:_ 12345678

h3. Notes

* It isn't also possible to preview the file on Confluence since it has no extension, Confluence doesn't how it should open this file.
* If the file is added to the page content, downloading the file from Page view is working as expected.

h3. Workaround

# Download the file
# Locally, change the file name by adding the correct extension to the end of it
# Re-upload the file by drag & drop in the attachments page
fields.summary: Files uploaded through the Choose File button on the attachments page lose their extension

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  
* When users get error messages when trying to perform some action in Confluence, they just get that message and are unable to self-serve and proceed to check the logs for more information.

h3. Suggested Solution  
* Allow the users to have access to their instance's logs.

h3. Why this is important   
* This will allow users to first try to find a solution based on the logs and, in case of assistance is needed, then proceed to open a ticket with the support team.

h3. Workaround 
* Currently, opening a support ticket in order for the engineers to investigate the root cause of the error messages.
fields.summary: Allow users to have access to their instance's logs

fields.description: Currently, it is not possible to change font/color/size of a placeholder within a template, would like to have an option in Confluence to customize these inside a template.
fields.summary: Customization of Place holder within a Template

fields.description:
Currently, the result of the Page Tree macro is not included when you export a page to PDF.
We can use the print function of the browser to show this, but it will be great if the native function support this.
fields.summary: Include the Page Tree macro result to the exported PDF

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When navigating the page tree ({{/wiki/spaces/<SPACEKEY>/pages}}) in an instance and clicking on some levels of nested pages, will make the site becomes unresponsive and eventually, an error message is shown.

h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Chrome, Firefox, Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create page tree a few levels deep.
 * Navigate through the page tree levels.

h3. Expected Results
 * The page tree levels are accessible by clicking.

h3. Actual Results
 * The site freezes.
 * Error messages appear:
 ** Chrome: "Page unresponsive - You can wait for it to become responsive or exit the page. Product Development - Confluence"
 ** Firefox: "A web page is slowing down your browser. What would you like to do?"
 ** Safari: spinning wheel
 * Console error:

{code:java}
Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Failed to execute 'fetch' on 'ServiceWorkerGlobalScope': 'only-if-cached' can be set only with 'same-origin' mode
    at frontend-service-worker-cache.js:129 {code}
The instance will keep unresponsive until a message informing that Service Worker has been successfully registered is returned.
{code:java}
SERVICE WORKER - Registration successful with scope:  https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/wiki/ {code}
h3. Workaround
 * None yet.
fields.summary: Page tree navigation makes the page unresponsive

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attaching more than 200 files to the same page will display as blank / Page not Found error

h3. Description

If there are more than 200 files attached to the same page, the page may either take too long to load (>60 seconds), not load at all or display a *Page not Found* error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# On any Confluence page, upload more than 200 attachments (>1 KB each)
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results

The page should display as expected.

h3. Actual Results

The page does not load and/or throws a *Page not Found* error.

h3. Workaround

Manually remove the attachments by downloading them on 
{{https://<instanceURL>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=<AffectedPageID>}} 
and re-upload them to a different page.
fields.summary: Attaching more than 200 files to the same page will display it as a blank / Page not Found

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Copying text while editing a page will cause it to jump up on IE 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# While editing a long Confluence page, scroll down to a point where you can't see the page's title anymore
# Select some part of the text
# Hit *Ctrl + C* on your keyboard or *Right Click + Copy*

h3. Expected Results
The selected text would be copied.

h3. Actual Results.
The page jumps up as if it had an anchor, but the text gets copied.
fields.summary: Copying Text while editing a page will cause it to jump up on IE 11

fields.description:
h5.The issue
Page Properties Report's pagination stuck after hitting 7th page

h5.Steps to replicate
# Create 40 pages (if you don't have that many) under the same space, all with Page Properties
# Set a label on those pages such as "test-page-properties"
# Create a new page and input a Page Properties Report, that filters all pages under the current space with the "test-page-property" label
# Try browsing from page 1 through 8 in the Page Properties Report table

h5.Expected Results
You'll be able to see all the content without any issues

h5.Actual results
When hitting page 7, even if you go straight to it, any other page of the pagination that you try to view, won't render the content. The report will get stuck with the content of the 7th page.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report pagination stuck

fields.description:
Combine the features of *Table of Contents macro*(which displays specified headings by levels) and the *Page Tree Macro* (which lists separate Confluence pages) to create a Table of Contents.

The idea would be creating a *master Table of Contents* that lists all pages as well as all headings of a specified level within each page listing.
fields.summary: Combine Page Tree and Table of Contents macros on a Master Table of Contents

fields.description: It would be really useful for my team to communicate our roadmap
fields.summary: Make the Data-Driven Roadmap macro available as a Cloud addon

fields.description:
On the stand-alone instance, there is an option for a user to perform a post action to: https://<instance name>/login.action and fill the 4 input fields os_username, os_password, os_destination and os_destination with the specific page the user has to.

Would be useful if this functionality is enable for Confluence Cloud user
fields.summary: Functionality for Confluence to remote access to page using Javascript

fields.description: R syntax support for the code block macro
fields.summary: R syntax support for code block

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On Confluence Cloud mobile view, when clicking the Livesearch macro, you are redirected to the App Store.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* iOS Mobile

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a page on Confluence Cloud. 
* Put it on edit mode and add the Livesearch macro by typing {livesearch} or by clicking on ... icon > Other macros > search for Livesearch > Insert.
* Publish the page. 
* Open the page on a mobile device on mobile view.
* Click on the Livesearch macro. 

h3. Expected Results
* The search is opened. 

h3. Actual Results
* You are redirected to the App Store.

h3. Notes
* Tested on iPhone 7, version 11.2.6. 

h3.Workaround
* Use the Confluence Cloud app.
fields.summary: Livesearch macro not working on Confluence mobile view

fields.description:
Per customer - 
|Our company employees cannot remember two weeks out, therefore, we feel it would be helpful to have a time card distribution separate from our payroll schedule. It is time consuming to print or save time cards for each employee and email them the respective employees for time approval weekly when we are on a bi-weekly schedule. My contact information is jsordelet@addova.com if you would like further details in regards to my request. Thank you for your time, Janelle| |
fields.summary: Time card distribution

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you disable the Workflow Approvals of a space and refresh the page, it will display as the Workflow is still Enabled, even though it is actually disabled on the space.

h3. Environment
* Comala Approvals add-on

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Comala Approvals in a Confluence instance;
# In a Confluence space go to *Space Tools >> Content Tools >> Approvals*;
# Disable the Workflow for that space and click on the *Save* button;
# Refresh the page.

h3. Expected Results
# The Workflow should be displayed as disabled.

h3. Actual Results
# The Workflow, even though being disabled, is displaying as *Enabled*.

h3.Workaround
* To enable the Workflow again, disable it, click on the *Save* button, then enable it and click again on the *Save* button.
fields.summary: Comala Workflow disable button isn't showing the correct information

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When adding a Jira gadget to a page, it will add extra margin to the page, squeezing the content of it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a Confluence page with content and publish it;
# You'll notice the size of the margins being like the _Screenshot1_;
 !Screenshot1.png|thumbnail! 
# Edit the page again and add a Jira gadget to it;
# Publish the page;
# The page's margin will now have an extra size, as per _Screenshot2_.
 !Screenshot2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Page margin's size remains the same;

h3. Actual Results
* Page margin's size will differ.

h3. Notes
* This problem is also triggered by the Page Tree macro.

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Extra margins in Confluence pages after adding Jira gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cannot download any export generated files in *Safari 11.1 with High Sierra 10.13.4* 
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # *Upgrade to High Sierra 10.13.4*
 # Open a new page in *Safari*
 # Export a space or generate a full site backup.
 # Try to use the generated URL to retrieve the export file.
 # Notice that nothing happens once you click on ”*Download here*" 

h3. Expected Results

The exported file should be successfully downloaded
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens once you click on “*Download here*”
h3. Notes

Customers mentioned that they are experiencing the same issue on MacOS Sierra 10.12.6 and Safari v 11.1.

This is not reproducible on MacOS 10.13.3 and Version 11.0.3
h3. Workaround

Try to download the file in another browser, for example, Google Chrome.
fields.summary: Cannot download export in Safari 11.1 with High Sierra 10.13.4

fields.description:
The site-logo mentioned in the doc: [New navigation and a new look for Confluence|[https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html]] and [Changing the Site Logo|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/changing-the-site-logo-724765495.html] is referring to the Confluence application logo: 

!image-2017-08-28-10-33-41-137.png|thumbnail!

but changing the site-logo from https://<instance>/wiki/admin/sitelogo/view-sitelogo.action will actually change the logo on the sidebar:
 !image-2017-08-28-10-34-21-986.png|thumbnail!

Example: 
 !image-2017-08-28-10-34-34-250.png|thumbnail!

Some user may think that the site-logo is actually the Confluence Logo on the top left corner and should be changeable.
fields.summary: Unable to change Application Logo (or Site Logo) and Allow Confluence/home logo to be changeable

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Page tree drawer opened from the minimized nav bar automatically collapses when clicking on arrow to expand/collapse children in the page tree
h3. Environment

Atlassian Confluence Cloud, New Look
 Replicated in Chrome, Firefox, and Safari.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a page and several children.
 * Minimize the sidebar.
 * Click on the Pages icon in the sidebar to open page tree drawer
 * Click on any *>* to expand a page that has children

h3. Expected results

The page tree drawer should stay open when interacting with expand/collapse arrow
h3. Actual Results

Page tree drawer is automatically closing.
h3. Workaround

Expand to the Full Sidebar to navigate to Child pages
h3. Notes
 * May be related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-58629
fields.summary: Page tree drawer collapses when clicking on arrow to expand/collapse children

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently while using Safari Version 11.1 (13605.1.33.1.2) there's no way to download media from pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a Confluence page with an attachment.
 # Click on the attachment.
 # At the preview window click on the download button.

h3. Expected Results

The attachment is downloaded.
h3. Actual Results

The download starts for a file called binary which keeps on downloading forever:
 !download.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

The issue is not reproducible in JIRA attachments.
h3. Workaround

Use another browser.

Rightclick & Download Linked file
fields.summary: Downloading Attachments files using Safari 11.1 fails

fields.description:
The new blog style has a fixed max-width of 680px.
This makes the blog in our case unusable, as we show wide tables and the layout is broken now.

How can I remove the max-width and make it responsive?

!blog.PNG!
fields.summary: How to remove the max-width of the new blog style?

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Newly created personal spaces now uses a space ID as a space key.

h3. Suggested Solution
To make it more user friendly looking, as a user, I would like to be able to choose my personal space key.
fields.summary: Allow for users to choose their personal space key

fields.description:
h3. Summary

An "Anonymous" entry is created on the Activity Stream (All updates) page if an inactive user changes its full name or if it was a creator of a personal space and got deactivated. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deactivate a user who created a personal space.
 # Go to the Activity Stream / All Updates page and reload.

OR
 # Deactivate a user
 # This user changes its full name (through its Atlassian Account)
 # Go to the Activity Stream / All Updates page and reload.

h3. Expected Results

No entry should be generated on the Activity Stream / All Updates page.
h3. Actual Results

An entry is created on the Activity Stream / All Updates page, as shown below:
|!Screen Shot 2018-05-14 at 14.04.22.png|thumbnail!|!anonymous_2.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Notes

Due to recent compliance changes, some accounts that are inactive for a long time are getting its full name changed. This is not a security risk, but an internal event. If you have any question, contact our [support|https://support.atlassian.com/] and mention this ticket.
h3. Workaround

No known workaround.
fields.summary: 'Anonymous' entry in the Activity Stream / All Updates page regarding inactive user or personal space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Chart macro doesn't work inside a dynamic macro

h3. Environment
*Add-on the issue was found in:* [Macro Toolbox for Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.addonengine.macrotoolboxforcloud/overview]
*Browser:* Chrome  59.0.3071.104 (Official Build) (64-bit)
*OS:* macOS 10.12.5
*Test Page:* https://goodsoftwarestaging.atlassian.net/wiki/x/AYBP

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a rich-text dynamic macro that renders its contents using the {{contentbody/convert}} API.
# Place a Chart macro inside the dynamic macro in a Confluence page, and save it.
# Load the page, and see that the Chart macro doesn't appear.

h3. Actual Results
The web request that causes the error is made from {{confluence.extra.chart:chart-macro-resources}} web resource.

{code}
// From Dev Console...

XMLHttpRequest cannot load https://goodsoftwarestaging.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/chart-macro/render. Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. Origin 'https://macro-toolbox-for-cloud.addonengine.com' is therefore not allowed access.
{code}

h3. Notes
Discovered by a customer of ours. The issue appears to be related to cross-origin requests.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Chart macro doesn't work inside a dynamic macro

fields.description:
h3.The Issue
When trying to edit a blog post on Confluence Cloud, the editor is not rendering if the user is on Firefox.

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Access your instance
# Go to a blog-post
# Ensure that the URL follows this syntax: https://<yourinstance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/blog/edit-v2/{contentID}
# Edit the page

h3. Expected Results
The editor would render and the user should be able to edit the blog content

h3. Actual Results
The Editor does not render at all.
fields.summary: Editor not rendering when editing blogs on Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
In a JIRA Project Release event in team calendars, the "Summary" and "View Issues" links leads to the same page in Jira.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Project Version in Jira (https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/viewing-a-project-s-versions-765593105.html) for a project, let's say project "N";
# Go to Team Calendar and add an event -> JIRA Project Releases for the project "N";
# Click on the created event and open both "Summary" and "View Issues" links.

h3. Expected Results
Each link would lead to their respective pages.

h3. Actual Results
Both links leads to the same page in JIRA.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: JIRA Project Release event in team calendars links leads to the same page

fields.description: When reordering a page from the reorder option from Content tools. It would be better if the hyperlink of the space name was removed or having it open in a new tab, to make sure it to be more obvious on how to expand the tree.
fields.summary: Removing hyperlink of space name when reordering page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Links do not save depending on how the selection of the text was made

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new page in Confluence
# Write at least 2 lines
# Select the first one, then drag the cursor to select the second one as well
# Then, move the cursor up to deselect the second line
# Click in the *Link* button at the toolbar or press *Cmd + K* or *Ctrl + K*
# Insert any kind of link (Page Link, Web Link) then click *Insert*. (Notice that once you do that, it'll escape a line, as if you had hit Enter)
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The link would appear normally.

h3. Actual Results

The link is not saved.

h3. Workarounds

* Edit the page, selecting only part of the text instead of the whole line.
fields.summary: Links do not save depending on how the selection was made

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Trying to Export a Space with an Apostrophe on its name will trigger a 'The space specified does not exist.' error

{panel:title=Info| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
This is likely not going to happen to newly created personal spaces, as they are not using the user's username anymore.
A numeric code is generated instead.
{panel}

h3. What to do?

Reach out for [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com] mentioning this bug ticket.
fields.summary: Trying to Export a Space with an Apostrophe on its name will trigger a 'The space specified does not exist.' error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cannot answer Confluence Questions due to title characters

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open *Questions for Confluence*
 # *Ask a new question*
 # Copy a long text (more than 255 characters)
 # *Paste long text to the Question title*
 # Notice that the *title is cut to 255 characters* (which is expected behaviour as this is the maximum number supported)
 # *Try to post an answer* that question and an error will be displayed:

{code:java}
Invalid request
Check your content and try resubmitting{code}
h3. Expected Results

Answers to long title questions should be successfully saved.
h3. Actual Results

Answers to that question cannot be saved due to an error message:

 
{code:java}
Invalid request
Check your content and try resubmitting
 {code}
 
{code:java}
Developer tools logs: app.7e54248dc918097b548e.js:1 Error: Error: Could not create content with type ac:com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:answer at new RestError (app.7e54248dc918097b548e.js:1) at app.7e54248dc918097b548e.js:1     {code}
h3. Notes

We have noticed that the issue is reproducible for the number of characters from 252 to 255. If we cut the title to 251 this issue is not reproducible.
h3. Workaround

Edit the question title and remove five characters, save it and after this the user will be able to successfully add an answer.
fields.summary: Cannot answer Confluence Questions due to title characters

fields.description:
Provide a way to render information, that *I'm legally responsible* for to publishing them on *every page*, like an Impressum and a Privacy Policy.
+Yes, every page includes the mobile representation, too. (as far a German law applies)
+

_With the default theme of the cloud version of confluence, t__his isn't possible._ 

The footer isn't visible on all but the desktop version of confluence, and even at the desktop version, it's missing on the search pages, overview page, in the spaces tool and many more for no apparent reason.
fields.summary: [footer][pages][mobile site / mobile app] footer isn't visible on all but the desktop version

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a default space logo is defined in the global configuration, it won't be possible to change a space's logo back to the default.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change any space's logo image;
 # Upload a image to be the default space logo in https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/configuredefaultspacelogo.action;
 # Try to change that space's logo (done in step 1) back to the default using the "Restore default" option on Space Settings;

h3. Expected Results

The logo should be changed to the one specified in step 2
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens and it shows an infinite spinner
h3. Notes

Error in the browser's console:
{code:java}
com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia:avatar-picker.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:60 Uncaught DOMException: Failed to execute 'toDataURL' on 'HTMLCanvasElement': Tainted canvases may not be exported.
    at b.getDataURI (https://dfyxoulrlyiv9.cloudfront.net/(...).atlassian.net/wiki/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/-505668794/h/0377a2ed2bd28caea2591944130f0d1e/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia:avatar-picker/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia:avatar-picker.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:60:1307)
    at b.cropToDataURI (https://dfyxoulrlyiv9.cloudfront.net/(...).atlassian.net/wiki/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/-505668794/h/0377a2ed2bd28caea2591944130f0d1e/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia:avatar-picker/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia:avatar-picker.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:60:730)
    at c.crop (https://dfyxoulrlyiv9.cloudfront.net/(...).atlassian.net/wiki/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/-505668794/h/0377a2ed2bd28caea2591944130f0d1e/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia:avatar-picker/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia:avatar-picker.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:90:2644)
    at d.chooseAvatar (https://dfyxoulrlyiv9.cloudfront.net/(...).atlassian.net/wiki/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/-505668794/h/0377a2ed2bd28caea2591944130f0d1e/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia:avatar-picker/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia:avatar-picker.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:105:3371)
    at HTMLButtonElement._onclick (https://dfyxoulrlyiv9.cloudfront.net/(...).atlassian.net/wiki/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/-505668794/h/ab07eceec48662a51f671f4943bd4d91/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:792:314)
    at HTMLButtonElement.dispatch (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/modules/jquery/1.7.2.1-confluence-custom-m04/jquery-min.js:2:4750)
    at HTMLButtonElement.s (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/modules/jquery/1.7.2.1-confluence-custom-m04/jquery-min.js:2:701)
{code}
h3. Workaround

Reupload the image to the space logo instead of using the "Restore default" option.
fields.summary: Unable to change space logo to default

fields.description:
When a user tries to narrow down a search using the IN SPACE field the suggested spaces are not always shown according to the search string, if the search string is also part of a question's name.
h3. How to Replicate
 # Create a space, lets say Confluence Support
 # Go to *Questions for Confluence* and create a question
 # In the question's name type in either Confluence or Support (or both)
 # Go to the Search page 
 # Try to fill in the IN SPACE field with the word Confluence or Support (or both)

h3. Expected Results

The Suggested Spaces list would show the Confluence Support space or any other space that matches the search string.
h3. Actual Results

The only suggestion shown is the space where the question (containing one or more words as part of its name) is actually linked to.

* note that the suggestions are pages and not spaces
h3. Additional Info

Checking the response when searching for either words from the example above it's possible to see that the desired space is actually amongst the elements in the resultant array, usually in the next position, but it didn't get to show up in the IN SPACE field.
fields.summary: Inconsistent search results for the IN SPACE filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Tables headers to not stick to the top of pages when there are cell lines merged.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence;
# Add a Table with several lines;
# Merge some cells lines;
# Scroll the page so the header sticks to the top of the page.

h3. Expected Results
* The table header sticks to the top of the page.

h3. Actual Results
* The table header does not stick to the top of the page.

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Fix Headers not working for Tables with merged cells

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user is not logged into id.atlassian.com, the user will see a blank page or page keeps on rendering on a restricted space for a public accessible Confluence site.


h3. Environment
- Public accessible Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- In a public Confluence site where the Anonymous access is set as "can use" in Global permissions
- space does not have Anonymous access set in space permissions settings.
- Using private browsing mode (incognito), access the space on #2

(i) Make sure it is not logged into id.atlassian.com

h3. Expected Results

- A "not permitted" message should be shown on the page.

h3. Actual Results

- Empty page 
- Page keeps on rendering 

*Application logs:*

{quote}
analytics-web-client.js:63 Uncaught (in promise) Error: Analytics Web Client Error: GraphQL error: , {}
    at analytics-web-client.js:63
{quote}
fields.summary: Blank page when accessing a restricted space in Public Confluence instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding code for first page on PDF Stylesheet truncates export on the right side.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Go to the instance PDF Stylesheet at https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/flyingpdf/viewpdfstyleconfig.action 
* On PDF Export Stylesheet > Edit.
* Add the following code: 
{code}
@page :first{         
margin: 0;      
padding: 0; 
}    
{code}
* Click Save.
* Create a page.
* Add enough text to generate more than one page when exporting, for example using the Lorem Ipsum macro. 
* Publish the page.
* Click the ... icon.
* Export to PDF. 


h3. Expected Results
* The first page of the document will have no margins, the other ones will be normal, with margins.

h3. Actual Results
* The first page of the document have no margins, but the other pages are truncated on the right.


h3.Workaround
* Removing the code from the PDF Stylesheet.
fields.summary: Adding code for first page on PDF Stylesheet truncates export on the right side

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Customer need the suggestive text (Instructional text) remain in the names of the columns as a tooltip.
{quote}[Is there] a option that permit other mode of suggestive text? This is because we review the texts and there are "instructions" that should not remain in the tables but we want them to remain visible in anyway.
{quote}
h3. Suggested Solution

Give the option for the Instructional Text to remain visible while editing the page.
h3. Workaround

Change the Instructional Text to normal text in the template.
fields.summary: Allow the Instructional Text to remain visible while editing the page

fields.description:
When a Confluence page has more than one [inline comment|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/comment-on-pages-and-blog-posts-724765350.html#Commentonpagesandblogposts-Addaninlinecomment] it reads incorrectly. For example, with 4 comments:

 

!there.png|thumbnail!

 

Instead of "there's", it should read "there are" when having more than one comment on the page.
fields.summary: Wrong Spelling for the "Inline Comments" Feature

fields.description:
In Confluence, the user does have the ability to share pages to the emails of non-existing Confluence users. When sharing the page, the same will receive the notification to see/edit the page. However, if the user does not have an account in the application, the same will be prompted with a message to use a different account in order to log in, since the same does not exist. 

 

The user will be only able to see/edit the page if the same has the permissions opened for anonymous. This is a suggestion to send an invite to the non-Confluence user in order to be able to join the application and edit the page.
fields.summary: Option to Invite New Users When Sharing Pages

fields.description:
*Summary*

Page tree loading spins forever when viewing a non-current version on a page

 

*Steps to Reproduce*

 
 # View any page with the sidebar open, confirm the page tree is shown
 # Go to the ... menu on the page and select page history
 # Select any non-current version 
 # Page tree on the sidebar does not load

  

*Expected Results*

The correct behavior is that page tree should show.

 *Actual Results*

The current behavior is that the page tree loading spins forever when viewing a non-current version on a page

*Notes*

*Workaround*

There is no known workaround
fields.summary: Page tree loading spins forever when viewing a non current version on a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Page Properties Report macro doesn't wrap up the contents in the columns to screen width when included Change history in the page

h3. How to Replicate
# Create a page and add 'Page Properties Report' macro in one section and 'Change History' macro in another section.
!a.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish the changes and view the page. The contents of the 'Page Properties Report' macro do not wrapped up to the screen width. 
!b.png|thumbnail!  
# Edit the page and remove Change History' macro.
# Notice that the 'Page Properties Report' macro wraps the contents to the page/screen width.
!c.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Workaround
No known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report macro doesn't wrap up the contents to screen width when included Change history in the page

fields.description:
Copied from [EAC2C-33|https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/EAC2C-33]

See above ticket for details.
fields.summary: Some comments show no name or icon (source)

fields.description:
Copied from [EAC2C-34|https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/EAC2C-34]
----

When entities.xml in a space export contains {{<ri:content-entity ri:content-id="12345">}}, these ids do not get renamed upon reimport, which causes whatever contains these content-entity tags to be broken -- usually links to pages / comments / attachments / whatever.
fields.summary: Attachments are broken in both pages and comments after space import

fields.description:
Copied from [EAC2C-68|https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/EAC2C-68] 
----
 

See [here|https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=3781625210] for reference.

TL;DR:

When macros aren't available in Cloud, they show up as a broken macro and users aren't able to access what's inside. This modification will make it so that the content in the macro (perhaps including parameters) will be accessible and editable.
fields.summary: Modify Unknown Macro Placeholder to Render Content

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sprint Burndown Gadget shows the label *Board* for the field *Sprint*.
 !59376.png! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page.
# Add a Sprint Burndown Gadget macro.

h3. Expected Results

The macro settings will show the label *Sprint* for the field *Sprint*.

h3. Actual Results

The macro settings shows the label *Board* for the field *Sprint*.
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown Gadget - Incorrect label for sprint.

fields.description:
Improve version comparison view, summary: page history difference and notifications emails. 

h5. The problem

It's difficult to skim trough the notifications e-mails and pinpoint the changes made. 
 It's also difficult to track down the changes made on the web-history view.
h5. Suggestion

Improve the 'diff' e-mails/page history, in a way we can easily see what has changed.
fields.summary: Improve version comparison views: page history difference and notifications emails
Creating a space and assigning groups via REST triggers "Incorrect Case" error for groups.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When mentioned a second time in the same page, user won't receive a notification

h3. Environment
* Confleunce Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Mention a user in a page and publish it.
# Edit the page again with any text (don't remove the mention).
# Mention the same user a second time

h3. Expected Results
The user will receive both mention notifications.

h3. Actual Results
The user won't receive the second mention's notification.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: User will not receive notification when mentioned a second time in a page

fields.description:
The customer wants the time cards to show each department, time spent in the department all  on the same day of the time card.

 

So for example if Employee A works 8-5pm. He works 8-12 as a server and from 1-5 as a bar back, they want both times to be shown on the the timecard for the day.
fields.summary: Enable a way for time cards to show different departments and time spent in each department per day.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Images inside Section Macros might not display on Firefox if there's a table inside the macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Page, add a Section Macro to it
# In this macro, hit *Enter* to create a new line, then upload an image
# After including the image, create a table, with at least one cell
# Publish the page

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The image would display normally in any browser.

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The image doesn't load on Firefox - while throwing a lot 302/304s on the browser's developer console.

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workarounds

* Remove either the image(s) or table(s) from the Section Macro and place it outside
fields.summary: Images inside Section Macros might not display on Firefox if there's a table inside the macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When including a *Highlight macro* and setting it to *'display inline'* mode, it still renders preceded by a newline, i.e. the highlighted text starts on a new line in the published document rather than on the same line as the text preceding it. 

The mode does affect the rendering, because if it's set to 'display on new line' mode (block mode) it is additionally followed by a newline.


h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* On a Confluence page on edit mode, type a few words.
* Add the Highlight macro by 
** typing {Highlight} OR
** clicking the + icon > Other macros > choose Highlight > Insert.
* Insert some text inside the macro.
* Click on the margin of the macro.
* Choose Diaply inline (screenshot attached).

h3. Expected Results
* The word(s) on highlight should be on the same line as the rest of the text.

h3. Actual Results
* The word(s) on highlight will go to another line, making it impossible to add word(s) highlighed on the middle or end of a phrase. 

h3.Workaround
* None yet.
fields.summary: Inline Highlight macro not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Templates that contain Code block macros will display a blank page when trying to create new pages or when trying to view the template.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a global template and add a code block macro to the template.
# save the template
# try to view the template

h3. Expected Results

The template preview is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The page is completely blank (no sidebar or top bar either)

There are Javascript errors in the console like this:
{noformat}
Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
    at RegExp.<anonymous> (_fix-re-wks.js:22)
    at String.replace (<anonymous>)
    at String.replace (com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin:syntaxhighlighter.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:5)
    at RegExp.<anonymous> (_fix-re-wks.js:22)
    at String.replace (<anonymous>)
    at String.replace (com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin:syntaxhighlighter.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:5)
    at RegExp.<anonymous> (_fix-re-wks.js:22)
    at String.replace (<anonymous>)
    at String.replace (com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin:syntaxhighlighter.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:5)
    at RegExp.<anonymous> (_fix-re-wks.js:22)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
N/a

h3.Workaround
There is no known workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Code Block Macro in Global Template prevents template from being rendered or used.

fields.description:
h3.The Suggestion
This is a suggestion in order to implement a statistic pages/panel on UPM so developers and administrators may have a clearer picture of the add-on usage on the instance.

h3.What about "Macro Usage"
The current "Macro Usage" page, is still limited, restricted pages, or spaces, will not be displayed there, which causes some discrepancies when trying to deal with numbers on the matter.
fields.summary: Implement Add-on usage statistics in UPM

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
This is a bug introduced in Chrome 65. According to [https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=829224] and [https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=826615], this bug is resolved in Chrome 67.0.3387.0. Target stable release for Chrome 67 is May 29 ([https://www.chromium.org/developers/calendar]).

We have confirmed the bug is fixed in current [Canary|https://www.google.co.jp/chrome/browser/canary.html] version (67.0.3390.0).
{panel}
h3. Summary

Japanese IME normally enters multiple letter combination entry state to express consonant+vowel letter such as "k" + "i" = "き", however the first consonant letter ( "k", in this example) is auto-committed in the Confluence editor, so the Japanese IME cannot enter the combination entry.

 !First consonant letter auto-committed on Japanese IME.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Client that runs the browser is
 * Windows and macOS
 * Chrome (Tested with ver. 65.0.3325.162)
 * Microsoft IME (Japanese) , Google Japanese IME, and Mac IME (Japanese)  (This means this occurs in any IME.)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a blank page and add elements as below.
 # Add a table.
 # Set IME to Japanese.
 # Type two letters in a cell (Consonant + Vowel)
 e.g.) Type "k"(Consonant) + "i"(Vowel).
 # Type No.4 letters again in a cell next to the No.4 cell
 e.g.) Type "k"(Consonant) + "i"(Vowel).

h3. Expected Results

"k" + "i" should be always converted to "き". ("ki" = "き" in Japanese)
[Firefox.mov|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/311190/Firefox.mov]

h3. Actual Results

"k" + "i" becomes "kい". The initial consonant letter is auto-committed. ("i" = "い" in Japanese)
[GoogleIME.mov|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/311188/GoogleIME.mov]
[MicrosoftIME.mov|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/311189/MicrosoftIME.mov]

h3. Notes
 * Please note this symptom is different from the issue CONFSERVER-54326 because it reports that first letter is "ignored" while the letter is "auto-committed" in this case.
 * This occurs only at the Chrome environment, and IE11 also has another issue(Cannot type double byte characters in Section through IE11). Firefox works fine.
 * As long as crawling the web and testing, this is apparently coming from a common malfunction of Chrome v65.x, however it is suspected any implementation on the Confluence is triggering the malfunctioning.
 * Evidences for the above statement are as below.     
 ** This has not occurred on Chrome v63.x and prior.
 ** There are related articles outside Atlassian product,
 *** [Latest Chrome 65 update breaks start of CJK IME input · Issue #2009 · quilljs/quill · GitHub|https://github.com/quilljs/quill/issues/2009]
 *** [576573 - Japanese IME: First character is auto-committed on office extensions - chromium - Monorail|https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=576573] (This is a bit old report, however still opened.)
 ***  [Google Groups – Chrome 65 アップデート後 Slack で一文字目が意図せず確定される問題について|https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/chrome-ja/toeoosmoBdo]


h3. Workaround
 * Delete the affected letter, and re-type the contents.
 * Add an empty space before typing the first letter.
 * Use Firefox browser.
fields.summary: Unable to type Japanese characters correctly in a table with Chrome 65+ in case that the more left cell is not empty

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When performing a HTML export, pages get an Attachment list at the bottom if the page contains attachments. This list is populated with deleted attachments as well causing links to lead to a _Page not found_ error when clicking on them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Delete an attachment from a page.
# Export that page as HTML with the Custom HTML export.

h3. Expected Results
The page is exported properly and only displays current attachments in the *Attachments* list.

h3. Actual Results
The page is exported properly and list all attachments that were ever attached to the page including deleted ones.
 
h3.Workaround
Purging the attachments from the Trash allows for them not to be displayed anymore.
fields.summary: HTML Export displays deleted attachment on page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After selecting multiple rows, copying and pasting into the table several times, all the pasted rows appeared as selected, the editor gets stuck couldn't de-select them. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create page
 * Insert a table with multiple rows
 * Copy and Paste multiple rows 

h3. Expected Results
 * Table Rows copied

h3. Actual Results
 * Pasted rows displayed as selected, the editor gets stuck. Not able to select anything on the grid. Please find the video attached: 

h3. Workaround (If there is no workaround directly say so)
 * Select the rows again and deselect it, then we are able to edit the grid again.
fields.summary: Copying & pasting multiple rows several times, pasted rows displayed as selected, not able to de-select.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* If you set up a Calendar with only one default Event Type (Jira Issue Date). When the "New Event" button is clicked on the calendar added to a page. The dialog "Create Event" appears, with spinning loading icon appearing next to the final section "Display". After a few seconds, the spinning icon disappears along with the heading "Display". It intermittently occurs when adding a new event.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a Calendar with only one default Event Type (Jira Issue Date)
# Add the calendar to a page
# Click on the "New Event" button

h3. Expected Results
* Display heading should appear to be able to add applicable filters.

h3. Actual Results
* Display heading disappears.

h3. Workaround
* Refresh the page and add a new Event
fields.summary: Adding event of type JIRA Issue Date: "Create Event" dialog box does not load "Display" section

fields.description:
Reproduced in this version:
Confluence 5.8.8 and 6.2.2
Google Chrome: 65.0.3325.162
Our customer recently upgrade their Chrome browser. They started to see this:

Create a new page in editor, insert a table and start to edit table header.
When input Chinese, the first letter is not treated as PINYIN, but left as english letter.
Things to observe:

When I type in other area on the same page within Editor, it is fine to type Chinese in PINYIN.
When type inside table cells other than table's column header, it is fine too. Could be something related to the headers?
And It is fine in Safari as well. So only latest Chrome browser have this problem.
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Error-Chinese-text-input-in-Confluence-when-upgraded-to-latest/qaq-p/754115#M101637

This issue is discovered in server, then also confirmed in Cloud.
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-55226
fields.summary: First letter typed in PINYIN input method is not recognised and treated as english in table header

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you're performing a Site Import on Confluence, after the file is uploaded and the import is started, the progress screen will display the message "_Acquiring an import lock..._", and depending on the size of the backup file this message may take a very long time to change which may give the impression that the import task is stuck.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Confluence Administration (Confluence-only sites) and select Import Site
# Choose a file and click the "Import" button

h3. Expected Results
The message on the progress screen would change to reflect the current state of the import taks
h3. Actual Results
The message constantly say "_Acquiring an import lock..._" and never changes.
fields.summary: Confluence Site Import progress message may take a very long time to change from "Acquiring an import lock..." message to the next

fields.description:
h3. Environment
* Confirmed on Firefox and Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the editor of Confluence, enter some double-byte characters(ex. あいうえお)
# Set the type of that character to "Preformatted"
 !スクリーンショット 2018-03-22 17.21.30.png|thumbnail! 
# Export page in PDF

h3. Expected Results
The PDF contains あいうえお

h3. Actual Results
The PDF doesn't contain あいうえお
 !スクリーンショット 2018-03-22 17.22.07.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* Use the print function provided by the browser
* Change the text setting to other types such as "paragraph"
fields.summary: Cannot export double-byte characters in pre tags to PDF

fields.description: It would be useful if users was allow to hide the left-hand grey panel in Confluence with an option.
fields.summary: Provide option to hide the left-hand panel entirely in the Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users with "add/delete page restrictions" space permission cannot change the restrictions on a page in the space without also having the "add page" space permission.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a test user and ensure that the user has permissions like this:
=== Bab Permissions ===
 !Bad Permissions.png|thumbnail! 
===
- With the test user, try to change the restrictions in any page.

h3. Expected Results

The user is able to set the restrictions in the page.

h3. Actual Results
The user is given a warning and is unable to edit the page restrictions:
=== Result ===
 !Result.png|thumbnail! 
===

 
h3. Notes
N/a

h3.Workaround
The only known workaround is to ensure the user has the "add page" permission.
fields.summary: Users with add/delete page restrictions space permission cannot change page restrictions without also having the add page space permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When placed in a page comment, the Expand macro will not work
h3. Environment
 * Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create and publish a page;
 # Write a comment and insert a bodied macro in it;
 # Publish the comment.

h3. Expected Results

The expand macro should work correctly, expanding its contents.
h3. Actual Results

The macro will not work properly, as you can see below:
|!Screen Shot 2018-03-21 at 18.32.16.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Insert an Expand macro also in the page's body will solve this.
fields.summary: Bodied macros aren't rendered correctly in comments
Fix InlineComment Webdriver test

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Blog posts created but not saved do not produce a draft under *Recently worked On*

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a blog post.
# Enter a title and content
# Hit *Close* without saving.

h3. Expected Results
Under *Recently Worked On* the blog post should show as a draft.

h3. Actual Results
The blog post does not show as a draft under *Recently Worked On*
 
h3. Notes
Related to the new editor in Confluence

h3.Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: Draft blog posts are not showing in Recently Worked On

fields.description:
For Confluence Server, you can disable the JIRA issue creation by disabling the plugin *Confluence and Jira Content Connector on the page*.

Related documentation: [How to Disable the Create JIRA Issue Functionality in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-disable-the-create-jira-issue-functionality-in-confluence-681902357.html/]

This plugin is not available in Confluence Cloud.

The site administrator should have the option to disable the JIRA issue creation in Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: Add the option to disable JIRA issue creation in Confluence Cloud.

fields.description:
Summary

When trying to configure code block macro in Confluence site-admin page, the page just blank and throwing some error from browser console.
{code}
Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
{code}

Steps to Reproduce

1. Visit Site Administration section of Confluence
2. Select Code Macro configuration from menu

Expected Result

Able to access the page for code macro configuration

Actual Results

Blank page is showing.

Workaround

Use Microsoft Edge or Internet Explorer

Being tested in Chrome, FireFox and Safari. All seems to be not working.
fields.summary: Configure Code block macro having Blank Page
